solution.text:
Firstly we need to draw the figure that will be formed by the revolution of a right angle triangle about its hypotenuse
We can see two cones , let us say that name the sides as shown in the figure.
From the right angle triangle(PQR) we calculate the value \(PR=\sqrt {pq^2+QR^2}= \sqrt {_{{3*j}}_^2+_{{4*j}}_^2}=_{{5*j}}_\)
So, sin \(\theta =\frac {QR}{PR} \) , cos \(\theta = \frac {PQ}{PR} \)
sin \(\theta =\frac {_{{3*j}}_}{_{{5*j}}_}=\frac 35\)
cos \(\theta =\frac {_{{4*j}}_}{_{{5*j}}_}=\frac 45\)
Now on revolving the triangle we can see that the \(r_1=r_2=PQ\,sin\theta \)
\(\Rightarrow PQ\,sin\theta = _{{4*j}}_\times \frac 35=\frac {_{{12*j}}_}5\)
Now, \(h_1=PQ cos\theta = _{{4*j}}_\times \frac 45=\frac {_{{16*j}}_}5\)
and \(h_2=QR \,cos (90-\theta) =QR\, sin\theta = _{{3*j}}_\times \frac 35=\frac {_{{9*j}}_}5\)
Now we have ,\(r_1=r_2=\frac {_{{12*j}}_}5,\,h_1=\frac {_{{16*j}}_}5,\,h_2=\frac {_{{9*j}}_}5\)
volume of the cones= \( \frac 13 \times \pi \times r_1^2 \times (h_1+h_2)\)
on putting the values we get,
\(\Rightarrow _{{trunc(pi_val*12*j*j*12*j/15,2)}}_\)

content.text:
A right-angled triangle, whose sides are _{{3*j}}_ cm and _{{4*j}}_ cm (other than hypotenuse) is made to revolve about its hypotenuse.
Find the volume of the double cone so formed.
